bibl.title: Territory of Washington V. Wilson D. Coyle. Matter of Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

msIdentifier.repository: Washington State Archives, Eastern Regional Branch
msIdentifier.collection: Spokane County Government; Clerk, Territorial Case Files, 1879-1889

div1.p: In the District Court of Washington Territory and for the Fourth Judicial District holding terms at Cheney.
In the matter of the application of Willis D. Coyle for a writ of Habeas Corpus.
To the Honorable George Turner Judge of said District Court

The petition of W. D. Coyle respectfully says that he is unlawfully imprisoned, detained confined and restrained of his liberty by E.F. Whittear in the Couty jail of Spokane County at Cheney in said County and Territory of Washington.
That the said imprisonment detention confinement and restraint are illegal and that the illegal thereof consists in this to wit

The said W D Coyle your petitioner was at the April Term of the aforesaid court held at Cheney in Spokane County Washington Territory in the year 1885 counted of the offense of assault and was by Grand Honor sentenced to imprisonment in the county jail for the term of sixty days and adjudged to pay a fine of Two hundred dollars and costs of writ
That your honor failed to order your petitioner to jail until said fine and costs were paid that a certified copy of said judgement or

sentence was delievered to said E F Whittear who is the lawfully qualified sheriff of said Spokane County and by virtue hereof the said E F Whittear took your petitioner into his charge and confined him in the county jail.

That your petitioner has served out the term of sixty days as sentenced by your honor and that the said E.F. Whittear is now holding and detaining your petitioner for the payment of said fine and costs

That this is the first application that has been made for a writ of Heabras Corpus Wherefore your petitioner prays that a writ of Habeas Corpus may be granted directed to the said E F Whittear commanding him to have the body of the said W D Coyle before your Honor at a time and place therein to be specified to do and receive what shall then and there by by your Honor considered and adjudged concerning him together with the time and cause of his detention and said writ and that he may be restored to his liberty Wilson D. Coyle
Territory of Washington} County of Spokane}
W D Coyle being first duly sworn on oath says that he is the identical person named in the foregoing petition as petitioner
That he knows the contents of said petition and that the facts therein stated are true.
Wilson D. Coyle
Subscribed and sworn to before me this third day of July 1885
H W Knox Notary Public
To the clerk of the District Court
Let the writ issue according to the of the petition, returnable before me at Chambers in the city of Spokane Falls at one o clock P.M. this day July 3d 1885 George Turner Judge

Upon hearing in this case it is ordered and adjudged that the defendant be discharged from custody and That the costs of this hearing be taxed to the county of Spokane. Done at chambers this 3d day of July 1885 George Turner Judge
In the matter of Petition for Habeas Corpus- W.D. Coyle
Filed July 3rd D. A. Clement Clerk By Chas B. Johnston Deputy
Recorded pp 607 & 8
